Posted By: MyrBattlecube (2/24/2011 10:46:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not horrible... He never sees the battlefield, but I like the instant speed for searching a [Mistveil Plains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mistveil Plains) or a [Moonring Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moonring Island) in my five color Cascade deck (the colorless cycling cost is revelant). In this strategy (Cascade), he also gives to me an additional trick to shuffle my library...  
  
Very ok in a White/Blue control deck that needs a lot of mana...   
  
Also, synergistic with Esper strategy ([Sanctum Gargoyle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanctum Gargoyle)). Nearly 3/5...

Posted By: Deepfried-Owls (6/16/2011 2:48:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really liked the older mutant cycle cards, 6 mana, a descent keyword ability, and landcycling in their color.  
  
While reminiscent of them but not as good, they dam well came in handy in the pre-release and I usually will chuck one or two into a color intensive deck for support, they still come in handy.  
  
remember these don't have to search for basic lands so you can use them to grab dual lands too, and for colorless mana as well, I don't really get why this is rated so low. If you cannot afford it, cycle it. If you can, its not a bad defender, the high cost is for utility!
posts.html:
I really liked the older mutant cycle cards, 6 mana, a descent keyword ability, and landcycling in their color.

While reminiscent of them but not as good, they dam well came in handy in the pre-release and I usually will chuck one or two into a color intensive deck for support, they still come in handy.

remember these don't have to search for basic lands so you can use them to grab dual lands too, and for colorless mana as well, I don't really get why this is rated so low. If you cannot afford it, cycle it. If you can, its not a bad defender, the high cost is for utility!
